definition: to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Upon receiving the bid documents, the bid inviter shall sign for and safe-keep them but may not open them.
sentences.chinese: 招标人收到投标文件后，应当签收保存，不得开启。

sentences.english: This is your insurance contract, please sign for it.
sentences.chinese: 这是您的保险合同，请签收。

sentences.english: Party A will issue a written receipt after receiving the payment.
sentences.chinese: 甲方收到租金后予书面签收。

sentences.english: Once the mediation agreement is signed and exchanged by both parties, it shall become legally binding.
sentences.chinese: 调解书经双方当事人签收后，即具有法律效力。

sentences.english: "The one you signed for, " she said calmly.
sentences.chinese: “就是你签收的那封，”她平静地说。

sentences.english: The statement of mediation shall take legal effect after acknowledgement by both parties.
sentences.chinese: 调解书经双方当事人签收后，发生法律效力。

sentences.english: A signed invoice presumes receipt of the shipment.
sentences.chinese: 经过签收的发货单表示运去货物已收到。

sentences.english: A conciliation statement shall have legal effect once signed and accepted by the parties.
sentences.chinese: 调解书经双方当事人签收后，即发生法律效力。

sentences.english: if the person is a legal person or other organization, the written decision shall be delivered to its reception office for a signed receipt.
sentences.chinese: 受送达人是法人或者其他组织的，交其收发部门签收。

sentences.english: After receiving packing list that client signed and stamped, check them and give to project manager.
sentences.chinese: 收到客户签收的回单后，核对后交给项目主管。

sentences.english: On the delivery, receiver is asked to sign the waybill with regular script.
sentences.chinese: 收件人签收邮件时亦应使用正楷签名。

sentences.english: The statement of mediation shall carry legal effect after acknowledgement.
sentences.chinese: 调解书经双方当事人签收后，发生法律效力。

sentences.english: The tenderer shall sign and keep the bid documents when receiving and may not open them.
sentences.chinese: 招标人收到投标文件后，应当签收保存，不得开启。

sentences.english: Please sign the receipt in duplicate.
sentences.chinese: 请一式两份签收这个单据。

sentences.english: The bill of mediation becomes legally effective after it has been delivered to the litigants and signed by them.
sentences.chinese: 调解书交双方当事人签收后，即具有法律效力。

sentences.english: After shipping company's signing, please return to us accompany with the original Letter of Guarantee.
sentences.chinese: 船公司签收后，请并附原保证函，寄回本行。

definition: to reject (visa application etc)/(commerce) to return to sender/item returned to sender
to return merchandise/to withdraw a product
